subcategory: Persistence of the ‘Family Comes First’ Mindset even after Completing the Returnship Program

content.text: This refers to a situation where employees who have taken a break from work to attend to family obligations, such as caregiving or parenting, may continue to prioritize their family responsibilities even after they return to work.
Women are expected to assume the role of primary caretaker for their families whether they are working or not.
There is a lack of help and support from the husband or in-laws.
There is a common belief that working women will have less time to devote to their children, impacting family life.
Initiate campaigns and awareness sessions for parents on gender equality to create a mindset that women are equal in society and can perform various roles.
Promote activities to allow people to share roles and understand the importance of women in both public and private spheres.
Involve religious communities to change the narrative of women being restricted to only household work.
